title: I either get shit team mates or assholes
body:
OK, there is also the occasional game I do play bad and have my ass handed to me, those games I accept.

Last game I had a bot laner who started being a %%%% from team select so I told him off. Game started and 30 seconds in he started giving shit again, than two more of my team started, it got 10 times worse from my first death until the end. Just shit talk to each other for no reason. I die once top, bot lane gets ganked and dies and guess what, it was all my fault for dying once.

For 32 minutes plus team select I had to listen to a little entitled shit who thought he was above everyone else. Do these players ever wonder why they are stuck at low rank? How many of you realise WHY Riot have a 'tip' stating that X% of games are lost when players are abusive? It is because it makes other players not give a shit and would rather lose just to see the assholes take a loss.

Players like that just make you not want to give a shit, they not only act like %%%%s in game by how they talk to others, but by how they play also. Low rank in this game is full of fuck and has so much salt it makes the Dead Sea look like fresh water. I did wonder why I stopped rank, but now I know, the assholes who just make your whole game experience bad.

And before you all state "OMG just mute him", no, that is not my point and that doesn't stop them from being %%%%s and not helping their team unless they can get a kill, and that is my point. If I had a reason to be bothered trying when I get one or more of these players, maybe I would, but as it stands if I am going to get an asshole who calls out each and everyone's mistakes whilst not accepting they also make mistakes, why should I be bothered to try and get a win? I have never yet had a win when I play with these players, the least I can do is put up with it and just take it easy. Or since I can see these types of players in team select, I should just start dodging.

I have tried making friends in game, currently I have 7 on my list. I don't keep players on my list unless they actually know what they are doing and am not always playing to get into games with people.

As for real life friends, I am a father and therefore can only play for X period a day.

Nothing is going to stop everyone from being toxic. There are going to be assholes everywhere, and that is ultimately out of our control. Sure we can report them, but honestly, it's gotten to the point where it's like your trying to murder as many people as possible hoping that you will eliminate the entire human race.

That's why people are saying "OMG mute him" because you are given the option to not deal with his toxicity.

I'll probably copy pasta this to everyone:

It is not just what they say, but how they play. You get those shits who talk tough, I just let them go and would rather lose the game simply because they don't deserve the win.

I more have the issue with those players who play either only for themselves, like the Zed 'support', or the LB top and those players who simply refuse to help anyone but the premades they are with.

Those are the toxic shits who shouldn't be here, they don't play a team game for the team and it ruins the playing experience for everyone else.

You than get those ultra bad players who can't even hold a lane for 5 minutes, that just makes the next at least 15 minutes pointless.

Ok I have never been in one of your games so I don't know how each game went. You say that these people are detrimental to the success of the game and although they do seem bad, I still find it hard to believe that they were the main reason you lost.

You had your rant, but now the only step left to take is to stop focusing on how bad they are and start looking at yourself critically, asking yourself what you could have done differently to change the outcome of the game, especially when you die.It's not like your perfect, everyone definitely has flaws in this type of game, but you can easily mistaken yourself for being better than you think you are if your constantly focusing on how bad other players are. You may see idiots all the time, it honestly doesn't make you any better than them. This is pretty much how pros become pros in the first place.

If you keep criticising yourself, start pointing out all the bad things you did wrong instead of them then I can guarantee you it will change the tide of games you never would of had to power to before simply because you weren't pushing yourself to become better.

Besides, if you don't criticise yourself alot on your decisions, and you just keep blaming your teammates, then no wonder you feel like you don't want to give a shit anymore.

Step 1: MUTE THEM
Steps 2 - 5: MUTE THEM
No but seriously, Mute them, Report them, and move on. I find that with most of my games I play, there is always at least 1 'higher than thou' toxic piece of banana peel, and I have no other choice than to mute them, and sometimes everyone else, because I refuse to be dragged down to their level.

Those that flame and rage for ANY reason at all mustn't know the concept of "fun" and should really go f--- themselves, there's no sugar coating it.

Literally the most fun thing about this game anymore is coming up with new insults for shit tier players who make shit tier plays.



>And I have no other choice than to mute them, and sometimes everyone else

So because one person made a less than friendly comment you think it is okay to shut out your entire team?
You are plague on this game, and your exaggerated response to harmless banter is the reason toxicity has such a huge impact on LoL games.


If everyone wasn't a five year old crybaby, toxicity would lessen.

First of all, if you find flaming people to be fun, you're the one who's a plague, and you should rethink your life >.>

Secondly, "harmless banter" isn't harmless at all, in fact, there are several documented reports of people being jailed simply for being abusive online. But you are quite stupid to believe I'd mute someone for "harmless banter", no, I'd mute them because they're toxic little shits like you who don't understand the concept of "fun", believe they should be in a rank higher than what they are, and constantly make the rest of the team go on tilt.

In fact, your entire reply is toxic, because all you've done is cause an unwanted argument, and insinuated that I'm a "plague" and a "5 year old crybaby". Really, I want to drag you through my screen and beat the ever--loving shit out of you right now, because that's really what you deserve.

"I'm so nice and hate people who use nasty words, but I am have no problems with physically beating people up"

If you are tilted by a few comments on the internet then don't play. You clearly aren't mature enough.

So true. Instead of complaining over and over, change YOUR style of play.

[Here is an example, click on it.](http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/128554454/200912352?tab=overview)

So what happened in this game? The duo Mundo and Volibear stated they would both feed in champ select before the game began, all because Voli has no balls due to the mid laner inadvertently banning a champion they wanted to play. So then Jinx decides at the start of the game to feed first in the bot lane and then follow Voli around their jungle, while cursing Voli all of the time. This leads to Fizz disconnecting for more than 15 minutes.

So, me being support, what did I do?

1. Muted all toxic talking noobs, i.e. the whole team but Fizz
2. Started FARMING. If Jinx and any other toxic noob wants farm, I tell them UNLUCKY, MY FARM, you won't need it, you're a feeder.
3. Start farming the jungle camps also after the enemy smashes your towers down. Be careful not to get caught, but hey in bronze its easy not to do this if you have a brain.
4. Defend tier 2 towers.

At this stage Fizz reconnected and Jinx started playing like they weren't a feeder. Of course the whole time, Mundo and Voli weren't feeding as they suggested in champ select. So we now had a team.

Next: Split push and win. Hopefully you have a capable champion that can do this. Kayle works well, so in bronze noob games I take her as support.

There you go my friend, change YOUR attitude and sometimes you can win games that look doomed. Remember 95% of OCE is trash level. Thats right, do the math. 200000 players, only 10000 are any good. Makes sense. School holidays are on, more toxicity by kids with no balls.

Just have fun, troll if you have to. Don't put up with people ruining your game though. Have a good one.
